UNITED STATES
ATOMIC ENERGY COMMISSION
IN REPLY REFER TO:
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
ISP:CH
June 27, 1951
Mr. Richard L. Rider
Manager
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dicks
Many thanks for the extra trouble you took to get the
information on projected use on the NAEB tape network
of "This New World of Atomic Energy."
I am sure you will be pleased to know that Morse
Salisbury, Director of the Division of Information
Services, Ned Trapnell, Associate Director, and
George Glasheen who is in charge of our educational
services, were highly pleased with the contents of
your letter. There are several programs in the planning
stage which may be of interest to you. However, I will
wait until they are further along before making any
pitch for possible use by NAEB.
If you ever get to Washington, please give me a ring
and letâ€˜s have lunch together.
Sincerely yours,
Charter Heslep, Chief
Radio-Television Branch
